meanings.definition: To rid of poison or the effect of poison.
meanings.sent1: I need to detoxicate the water before drinking it.
meanings.sent2: The doctor will detoxicate the patient's system after the snake bite.
meanings.sent3: She tried to detoxicate her mind from negative thoughts.
meanings.sent4: His positive attitude helped detoxicate the toxic environment at work.
meanings.sent5: The cleaning crew worked hard to detoxicate the contaminated area.

meanings.definition: To remove toxic substances from the body.
meanings.sent1: Eating healthy foods can help detoxicate your body naturally.
meanings.sent2: After the party, she needed to detoxicate from all the junk food.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he needed to detoxicate after eating too much cake.
meanings.sent4: The fitness trainer recommended a special drink to detoxicate the body.
meanings.sent5: The spa offers treatments to detoxicate and rejuvenate the skin.

meanings.sent1: The air purifier helps detoxicate the air in the room.
meanings.sent2: She decided to detoxicate her wardrobe by donating old clothes.
meanings.sent3: The ritual was believed to detoxicate the soul and bring good luck.
meanings.sent4: The rain helped detoxicate the pollution in the city.
meanings.sent5: The herbal tea is known to detoxicate the body and improve digestion.
